definition: variant of 反覆|反复[fan3 fu4]
repeatedly/over and over/to upend/unstable/to come and go/(of an illness) to return
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
repeatedly/time and time again
unstable/erratic/changeable/fickle
tautology

sentences.english: I am tired of hunting the same old coon.
sentences.chinese: 反复干同样的事，我真干腻了。

sentences.english: The reason flu keeps infecting us again and again is that the virus is constantly changing.
sentences.chinese: 流感能够反复感染我们的原因在于病毒的不断变化。

sentences.english: Repeated hitting raised a large bruise.
sentences.chinese: 反复击打造成一大块青肿。

sentences.english: I counted every day the date when jack would return.
sentences.chinese: 我每天反反复复的数着安杰的归期。

sentences.english: I repeated them until I could recite seventy stories without dropping a word.
sentences.chinese: 我反复背诵，直到我能一字不漏地背出七十篇故事来。

sentences.english: Because embolus can fall off repeatedly, have a relapse easily so.
sentences.chinese: 由于栓子可以反复脱落，所以容易复发。

sentences.english: We don’t want to ding them with fines.
sentences.chinese: 我们并不想反复地跟他们讲罚款。

sentences.english: Significant differences between the bronchial asthma and the repeated respiratory infections were found.
sentences.chinese: 发现支气管哮喘和反复呼吸道感染之间差别显著。

sentences.english: Sound background have 5 reiterative wilds sounds.
sentences.chinese: 健全的背景有5反复荒野的声音。

sentences.english: He repeats the same thing over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 反复干同样的事，我真干腻了。

sentences.english: You sit crouched in your palanquin and repeat the names of the gods in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 你蹲坐在你的轿子里，嘴里反复地祷念着神的名字。

sentences.english: He ruminated over various possibilities concerning his future.
sentences.chinese: 他反复思考自己前途的各种可能性。

sentences.english: Markets see-sawed all day, with S&P officials refusing to comment on their plans.
sentences.chinese: 市场全天反复涨跌，标普高管拒绝就其计划置评。

sentences.english: Bacteria and virus infection and easy to.
sentences.chinese: 细菌和病毒容易反复感染。

sentences.english: Don't chant things like "loser" or taunt them when they lose.
sentences.chinese: 不要反复喊着“失败者”或者奚落他们。

sentences.english: They have made many trips traveling both north and south on the eastern intercoastal waterway.
sentences.chinese: 他们在东海岸内陆航道上有过反复多次的南北航行。

definition: repeatedly/time and time again
variant of 重複|重复[chong2 fu4]
to repeat/to duplicate/CL:個|个[ge4]
a two-man saw/fig. to-and-fro between two sides
several times
to make a round trip/return journey/back and forth/to and fro/repeatedly
course of events/process/CL:個|个[ge4]
to pass/to go through/process/course/CL:個|个[ge4]
unceasing/uninterrupted/continuous/constant
second (i.e. number two)/second time/twice/(math.) quadratic (of degree two)
one time (all the way through)/once through
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to vibrate/to shake/to shudder
careful/attentive/cautious
to continue/to persist/sustainable/preservation
long term/long time/long range (of a forecast)
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
